document.docTitle: Osbornellus springerae Dominguez & Godoy 2010, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of the genus Osbornellus Ball (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae) in Central America 2702

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of the genus Osbornellus Ball (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae) in Central America 2702

heading.emphasis:
Osbornellus springerae Domínguez & Godoy
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Length: 4.8–6.3 mm . Member of the
O. auronitens
group ( Figs. 1a ). General description as in
O. eberhardi
.

Diagnosis. Similar to
O. anonae
externally, but in ventral view the ventral processes of
O. springerae
arise one-quarter of the way along the length of the aedeagus and they diverge from a wide base; the shaft is nearly the same length as the ventral processes. In
O. anonae ,
the ventral processes arise nearly half way along the length of the shaft, the base in lateral view is not as wide, and the shaft and ventral processes remain together for short distance.
Distribution. Known from Costa Rica and Panama ; 300–2600 m .
Etymology. This species is named for Monika Springer in recognition of her studies of aquatic insects and help provided to the first author’s thesis research.
